column5: Johny bass and I headed up to simcoe last week to target largies and smallies. As of last week our summer smallie spots were pretty much dry...fish must have moved to 20 to 30 FOW already (fall pattern). We checked out a couple smallie spots with no luck so decided to hit up some flippin jig largies action. We caught four or Five in an hour or so. No real hogs, Biggest was 4lbs.      Only had about 20 min of daylight left and we wanted some smallies....went to a spot near by and got a double header...a 4lber and a 2.5lber...Nice way to finish an eveing fish      We had to work for our fish But was a great day on the water.  Thanks for reading and goodluck on the water.
Great Report and nice pics! That last smallie looks real healthy.
nice report, some of you guys have been out there giving the bass a good whoopin
Good Stuff Guys  , I cant wait to give the fall pattern a try never did it so it's gonna be a learning curve.
As usual you guys are slammin some big bass.  Well done!
Nice job boys, some good looking bass there.
Yes, nice bass for sure. Congrats. Are you sure all y'all aren't from Alabananas?
Great report and pics snagmasteral  That 4lbs smallie is real hog Thanks for sharing Leechman
Simcoe has been stingy this year hasn't it?  That said you guys did all right, I'm still looking for a legit 4lber this year so congrats and thanks for the update.
Good job out there, a nice way to end the day of with that clean smallie.  Thanks for sharing and keep up the hurt on those bass!
Nice report, I need to get up there before ICE
Ya. We really worked for our fish! That 4lber right before dark really made my day!
Way to go AL and JB. Nice Bass!
Nice fish guys, You sure know how to bag em... Thanks for posting
some fine looking bass, thanks for the report
thanks for the kind words guys....yeah simco has been a bit tough this year but always manage to get to land some decent fish , but not the best for numbers this year...well for me atleast
